basics.name: Adam Kiss
basics.label: Principal Engineer
basics.summary:
Having exposure to a variety of IT technologies is one thing, knowing how to leverage them to drive a business forward is another. My analysis is not stuck simply to the software stack, but to technology as a whole which can lead to drastic resource/time savings. I Have strong exposure in the Finance sector, specifically Banking, Government Treasury, Insurance and more recently Consulting on Cloud transitions for Airlines, Gas/Power companies and other large financial orgs. I feel the experience I have gained is strongly applicable to IT roles that focus on the following:

Driving automation

- A keen sense in detecting workflows that drain resources, slow down overnight processing runs or tasks that are asking to be automated. 
- Migrating complex jobs, splitting up and leveraging cloud technologies such as event driven serverless or containerised scaling solutions. 

Cloud transitions

- Exposed to the considerations of resourcing, security, performance and automation that projects under Amazon Cloud (AWS) & Google Cloud (GCP)  architecture can bring.
- Design, deployment and support of AWS environments with focus on Immutable Infrastructure as Code solutions rather than classical mode 1 deployments, leveraging leading industry tooling.
- Live application troubleshooting providing technical assistance to development teams.
- Extensive application migration experience for a number of clients - Rehost, Replatform & Refactor. 

Project driven results

- Recognised as a strong technical communicator with the ability to form strong bonds with non IT sections of the business and absorb the big picture and fill in the gaps to reach milestones.
- Strong agile mindset, able to efficiently utilise own time as well as others by running to the point workshops to deliver team based outcomes.
- Pivotal member of a project team involved in a six month critical data centre move with role including vendor relations, business continuity as well as all technical aspects of the move.

Continuation of my role with Nebulr post Contino merger. 

Currently focusing on assisting clients grow in ability and confidence moving into AWS, transforming mindsets to target automation and efficiency in the cloud. Deploying infrastructure as code, ensuring a secure and maintainable/documented/tested environment is handed to the client. 

Providing technical analysis for application migrations, pro's and con's of the variety of options and assisting the business with workshops to up-skill the teams to complete the migration events. 

Have a deep understanding on all aspects of cloud adoption:
- Experience building & managing automated complex multi-region landing zones: Terraform, Cloudformation & other automated deployment tools/pipelines
- Running workshops to address tech debt or team limitations
- Solving complex network, security or application requirements for hybrid systems
- Pair programming with fellow engineers to upskill
- Running application migration events at high velocity to realise business value

references.name: Gayle Rossell
references.reference: I worked with Adam for 5 years at Calliden/Calibre/Munich Re.  During this time Adam had a key role in the implementation and delivery of our ever changing IT Technology,  His knowledge of Active Batch enabled us to improve our daily work processes which greatly enhanced tasks for all staff.  We worked together on numerous tasks including AH system releases and user problems.  Adam has been a great asset to the company and is well admired by all of the staff for his willingness to help and go "above & beyond" to address problems.  I wouldn't hesitate in working with Adam again if I am fortunate enough to have that opportunity.

references.name: Bojan Tadic
references.reference: I've had the privilege of working with Adam for the past five years as part of an IT infrastructure team in Melbourne. Adam is a detail-oriented Systems Engineer who possesses a broad experience and knowledge of network, physical and virtual infrastructure systems. He is an energetic person who does not hesitate to tackle any problem with a large dose of creative reasoning and hard logic in order to find a viable solution. I feel Adam excels at exploring/bouncing/implementing new ideas and concepts and I would welcome an opportunity to work with him again in the future.
